BES NEWS - Baldwin Elementary 3-5th grade students got into the holiday spirit, AND learned about cooperation, emotional well being and cross-curricular connections last week after participating in a lesson on the history of social and country dancing in America. We discussed the roots of contra and square dancing, and how the patterns and counting in dance steps all relate to mathematics. We talked about how dance etiquette and behavior is a very helpful social skill to have, and that the physical and connective aspect of dancing makes us FEEL GOOD. The students loved performing the dance, and begged to learn more. We will now be making dance a monthly activity in the music classroom. Mrs. Yiberhu's classroom did a wonderful job learning the dance, and would proudly like to show our families what it looks like:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jqEgW5U-ic0
